result.execSummary:
The defendant Willie R. Lay Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca(2nd+), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   Submit to a DNA sample and pay surcharge.
DOC shall promptly notify the court of any new arrest or criminal charge.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Jessica Krejcaek appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Dirk Jensen.  Sentencing arguments made.  Deft sentenced to 2yrs WSP concurrent to present sentence; initial confinement of 1yr followed by 1yr of ES.  See conditions.  Deft not eligible for CIP or SAP.  Credit for 452 days.  Prosecution costs ordered.  Appeal rights.  Firearm warning.  Voting acknowledgment.  DNA ordered; notice given to deft

Special Prosecutor Attorney Jerrold Hinshaw appeared for the State.  Def. appeared (in custody from Fox Lake Correctional) with Atty Dirk Jensen.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  On State motion, repeater enhancer dropped.  Plea of no contest to Possession of Cocaine, 2nd+ offense; found guilty by the Court.  Presentence investigation ordered.  Sentencing 4/29/15 at 2:30.  Bond continued.
Final pre-trial on March 26, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
in Support of Motion to Withdraw
To Withdraw As Counsel

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Dirk Jensen.  Atty Jensen filed a motion to w/draw today.  Discussion ensues regarding DNA testing.  Atty Jensen reports the PD's office will not approve any funds for DNA testing.  Before the court will consider authorizing public funds to cover DNA testing, there needs to be proof that evidence would be detected on the baggie.  No action taken at this time on the motion to w/draw; deft and Atty Jensen to confer prior to the next court date.  FPT 3/27/15 @ 1:15pm, JS 4/27/15 @ 9am
from deft re: Request for Indigency Forms for DNA testing, Requesting for Appointing a New Atty; copy sent to attys

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Dirk Jensen.  Atty Jensen reports the case is not resolved; awaiting for DNA testing/results.  Deft no longer has the funds to have the DNA tested - Atty Jensen reports he has submitted a request to the PD's office to seek funds to have the DNA tested.  Atty Jensen will also submit an indigency evaluation to the PD's office to see if the deft is now indigent.  FPT 2/6/15 @ 10am, JS 2/23/15 @ 9am

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Atty Dirk Jensen appeared on behalf of deft.  Deft recently sent to Dodge Corr.  Atty Jensen reports the deft's family has not had the funds to have the drugs tested.  Atty Jensen also reports it is difficult to speak with his client so all conferences are done via phone.  FPT/status set for 12/15/14 @ 9am.

Defendant Willie R. Lay appeared with Attorney Dirk C Jensen.  Defendant in custody @ KCDC.  Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the Prosecution.  Court Reporter:  Cyndi Chike.  Clerk: J. Mattner.
MINUTES:  Victim rights compliance.  Matter is unresolved, jury trial requested by the defendant, def. withdraws his two pro se motions and speedy trial demand made.  Court orders all witness lists to be filed within 30 days.  Bond continued.  Jury selection scheduled for September 22, 2014 at 09:00 am.

to withdraw; filed by Atty H Koesser.

Attorney Andrew Burgoyne appeared for the State. Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty. Hans Koesser. Clerk LE. Court takes judicial notice of conviction in 08CF933. Plea offer placed on the record by ADA Burgoyne. Def. rejects offer and it is withdrawn by State. KPD Officer Nicholas Benvenuto sworn in and testified on behalf of the State. Cross-examination by Atty. Koesser. Probable cause found. Bound over to Br. 6 for arraignment on 2-25-14 @ 8:15am. Information filed. Bond continued.
Hans Koesser
